body.p: A survey of a random sample of 1,500 young Americans found that 87% had earned their high school diploma. Based on these results, the 95% confidence interval for the proportion of young Americans who have earned their high school diploma is (0.853,0.887) What is the margin of error for this confidence interval?

response.feedback: Correct. The margin of error is half the length of the interval, so Length = 0.887 − 0.853 = 0.034 and 0.034/2 = 0.017.
Incorrect. This is the length of the interval. Remember the margin of error is equal to half the length of the interval.

Incorrect. It appears you found the midpoint of the interval which is the point estimate or sample proportion of young Americans who have earned a high school diploma. Remember the margin of error is equal to half the length of the interval.
